intro: Milnea harmandiana, commonly known as the Harmand's milnea, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of Mexico. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in spring. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and thrives in well-drained conditions. Its foliage consists of narrow, grass-like leaves that form a basal rosette. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
